challenges.title: Wallet Security Scenario
challenges.description: Choose the best security practices for different scenarios

scenarios.situation: Storing large amounts of cryptocurrency long-term

options.text: Keep on exchange for quick trading
options.explanation: Exchanges are targets for hackers and you don't control the private keys

options.text: Use hardware wallet with multi-sig backup
options.explanation: Hardware wallets keep keys offline and multi-sig provides additional security

options.text: Write private key on paper only
options.explanation: Paper can be lost, damaged, or stolen with no backup

educational.title: Cryptocurrency Security Best Practices
educational.explanation: Proper security practices are essential for protecting your cryptocurrency investments. Different storage methods offer different levels of security and convenience.
keyPoints: Hardware wallets provide the best security for long-term storage
Multi-signature wallets require multiple keys to authorize transactions
Never store large amounts on exchanges for extended periods

detailedLearning.whatYourelearning: The critical security practices that protect cryptocurrency from theft, loss, and unauthorized access.

Hot Storage.cons: Vulnerable to hacking, malware, and exchange failures

Cold Storage.definition: Wallets that never connect to the internet
Cold Storage.pros: Maximum security, immune to online attacks

Multi-Signature.definition: Requires multiple private keys to authorize transactions
Multi-Signature.pros: No single point of failure, shared custody
